page.title: 05BURHAM - THE GAMEKEEPER
page.content: His main task is to rear and care for game pheasants and partridge. He feeds them twice daily on {feed rides }in the woods with wheat, whole maize and protein pellets until 16 weeks old, then just wheat and maize. The birds come to his whistle to be fed. Each year 2000 birds are released onto the estate but only 40% are shot. He wears natural colours and is easily recognised by the wild life. Although he organises shooting parties he is concerned more about conservation of all wild life and its environment, which includes keeping the general public off this private land. The job has become his lifetimes work as he began as a boy {beater }and is now obviously enjoying caring for the land as the gamekeeper.
